title: 71 Best Gifts for Men That Won’t Disappoint
description: Impress him with the best gadgets, games, and more
author: Audrey Lee, Erika Owen
excerpt: Impress him with one of our gifts for men—including a new pizza oven, some staples from Patagonia, or a splurge worthy massage gun.
text: Guys are notoriously hard to shop for, so finding the perfect gifts for the men in your life can be a challenge. What do you buy for the dad who says he needs socks for the fifth year in a row? (Hint: definitely not the socks he’s been buying himself.) Or the brother with a splurge-laden wish list of expensive gadgets and watches? (Hint: neither of those things.) Or the husband who would be happy with no gift at all (or worse, a gift card)? (Hint: not nothing…also, can’t relate!)The answer is a set of cozy Bombas socks. Or an Ooni gas-powered pizza oven. Or a stylish Shinola desk clock. Or any of the very covetable presents on this list, which we compiled specifically to please your pickiest, unhelpful-hint-giving (favorite) men. So, without further ado, we present to you the best gifts for men.Shop Our Top PicksBest for self-care enthusiasts: Theragun Prime Plus, $399 from TherabodyBest for aspiring chefs: Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399 now $319 from OoniBest bling: Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet, $98 from MejuriBest for travel: Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack, $198 from LululemonShop by section:Accessories & apparel giftsHome & kitchen giftsSelf-care & tech giftsAccessories & ApparelLululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle BackpackNever underestimate the power of a really good duffel bag. This one seamlessly transforms into a backpack—a massive feature if the guy in your life is often on the go. It’s made with water-repellant fabric, tons of exterior and interior pocket space, a handy water bottle pouch, adjustable straps, and a sleek look that won’t drag their travel outfit down.Bottega Veneta Intrecciato Leather Card CaseA black leather wallet is expected. But a slim card holder with Bottega’s signature leather weave? Just the right kind of surprise.Sterling Silver Kintsugi Cufflinks by Posh Totty DesignsSometimes a unique pair of cufflinks is just the thing to take a tried-and-true suit to the next level. We love this Kintsugi-inspired design—as would the man in your life who just went on a recent trip to Japan.Barbour Ashby Waxed Cotton JacketThis classic wax jacket can easily be dressed up or down—whether you’re headed to the office or Glastonbury festival. Barbour is a classic for a reason—the English brand has nailed the balance between “lightweight and breathable” and “durable enough to qualify as a family heirloom.”On Lightweight CapA fully waterproof hat is hard to come by—ask any hiker, cyclist, or Seattleite. This design from athletic brand On has laser-cut panels from increased breathability and a buckle strap for easy adjustment, and there’s a matching top and jacket (hint, hint).Quince Onyx Rectangular RingSome of the best men’s gifts come in small packages—like this 18k gold vermeil ring. It’s subtle enough to pair well with a T-shirt but can pull its own weight with a suit as well.Mejuri Square Box Chain BraceletAvailable in sterling silver or 14k gold, this simple bracelet is the perfect accessory for any outfit.A.P.C. Treck BackpackLevel up his college-era backpack with this sleek A.P.C. number. It’s designed with adjustable padded shoulder straps for maximum comfort and has a branded carabiner clip that’ll be a subtle nod to his climbing hobby.Bombas Sunday SlipperIt’s more than likely the old slippers he’s using are hanging on by a thread. These elevated designs from Bombas are ultra cozy and won’t be an eyesore.Polo Ralph Lauren Plaid Fringe Wool ScarfA luxe scarf is one of those things we’ll always want but won’t necessarily buy for ourselves. But unwrapping a present and seeing the peek of plaid and fringe? You won’t find many people who wouldn’t be delighted to open up a stylish scarf. This design from Polo is the perfect pop of color for any look.Patagonia Synchilla Fleece GlovesIf his favorite T-shirts and pullovers come from Patagonia, these gloves in the brand’s warm Synchilla recycled fleece material will likely be a winner.L.L. Bean Men's Mountain Classic Quilted Ankle BootsIndoor slippers are one thing, but backyard slippers? There’s a concept. Sometimes you just have to hop outside for a second. A supportive footbed paired with fleece lining and a non-slip rubber sole makes these a powerhouse without skimping on maximum loungewear-level comfort.Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed BeanieCrafted with Mongolian cashmere, this super soft ribbed beanie is a wintertime staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie). Your man can rock it throughout the winter.Buck Mason Vintage Thermal HenleyWhile sweats will always have their place in a loungewear collection, we’re all about the henleys for cooler temps. Made of woven cotton and available in five rich colors, this tee plays well as a layer or on its own with a pair of jeans. He’ll love the versatility, which is a gift in itself.Parachute Cloud Cotton RobeThis lightweight Turkish cotton bath robe is exactly what he’ll want to put on after getting out of bed during lazy mornings when he’s got time to lounge around.Eberjey William Tencel Modal Long PJ SetAgain, pajamas and loungewear are always a treat—especially when they’re insanely soft like this sustainable Tencel Modal Eberjey set. The matching button-down top and pull-on bottoms feature white piping for a classic look.Bombas Men's Merino Wool Blend Quarter SocksOne serious pop of color paired with a tried-and-true neutral—this is what a gift set of socks should be. Made of a super comfortable merino wool blend, they’ll feel like they’re walking on clouds all day long. We’ll stand behind it: Socks make for the best gift, no matter the celebration.The North Face Thermoball Traction Mule V Mens SlippersHe’ll think of you every time he slides into these rubber-sole slippers (which will be often).On Cloud 5 SneakersThe lightest-weight sneaker imaginable, On Cloud 5s are engineered for an active lifestyle. Your sporty dude can wear them all day long, from the gym to the streets.Alex Mill Garment Dyed Work JacketFor your favorite fashionisto, this timeless work jacket from New York–based Alex Mill is a great gift idea that can be dressed up or down. The sturdy recycled denim fabric is peppered with flecks of natural cotton for an artisan texture.MOFT Flash Wallet and StandSome people don’t love bulky phone cases with PopSockets and other gadgets…. But they still want a better grip and a spot to store often-used cards. This wallet doubles as a magnetic stand, meaning they can flip their phone into viewing mode in an instant.Arc'teryx Atom Insulated JacketArc'teryx's lightweight windbreaker is an ideal get for just about anyone on your list—from the guy who likes to jog in subzero temperatures to the jetsetter who always needs more room in his carry-on.Snow Peak Fire-Resistant Outdoor CapYou can never have too many caps—especially ones that are made from water-resistant and flame-retardant materials like this Snow Peak design.Omega SpeedMaster Professional MoonwatchAn exceptional guy calls for an exceptional timepiece. For marking especially important holidays or milestones, this Omega watch is a gift that will be hard to topMark & Graham Monogrammed Travel Watch RollIf they can’t be seen without their favorite watch (or second-favorite, or third-favorite) fastened around their wrist, upgrade their travel accessory situation with this personalized gift. Made of durable polyurethane exterior and a soft microsuede interior (no scratches here!), there’s enough room for three watches inside.Home & KitchenShinola Runwell Desk ClockEven better than wrist candy, this chrome-and-black Shinola desk clock is the perfect home decor gift for your watch collector brother. Plus, the handsome timepiece is accompanied by a convenient wooden stand.Atlas Coffee Club Gift SubscriptionThis gift subscription from Atlas Coffee Company will supply him with three-to-twelve months of the best beans around. You'll be able to select when shipments start and each delivery postcards and tasting notes.Revival Molecule DoormatA color block welcome mat like this design from Revival could also double as a housewarming gift for your friend who just moved into a new bachelor pad.Braun Classic Analogue Wall ClockWe all have that friend who is constantly late. This wall clock probably won’t help that cause, but its slight utilitarian vibe makes it a designer-level addition to any room.Make Your Own Hot Sauce KitIt seems like there are only two sides to the hot sauce spectrum: You either love it—like “can’t get enough heat” kind of obsession—or you avoid it at all costs. For the former, this set will let them tweak that liquid gold within an inch of the preference.Philips Hue Smart LED Bar LightThe Hue Smart Bar is a surprisingly versatile gadget. He can stand it on his desk or mount it to the wall for an added light source or even upgrade his entertainment system by using it as a TV backlight.Technivorm Moccamaster 53942 KBGVThe sunny Moccamaster coffee maker from Technivorm is one of the most stylish machines out there. Thanks to its simplicity and dialed-in design, it’s super easy to use—you just fill the brew basket, add water, and flip the on/off switch. It brews in just 5-6 minutes and can handle up to 10 cups of coffee at one time. Plus, the pop of yellow would look great on any countertopCraighill Cal Bookend (Pair)Bibliophiles and paperback aficionados can rest assured that these sleek-looking bookends from Craighill will support their reads.Weber Small Stainless Steel Vegetable BasketFor the BBQ grill master who has everything, this small vegetable basket will always be appreciated. It helps keep veggies fresh and grill-mark-free while delivering all the flavor a grill has to offer.Corkcicle Chillsner (Two-Pack)Beer bottles, on the other hand, are best kept chilled with Corkcicle’s Chillsner, an icy stick that you pop in the freezer (and a best seller from our Father’s Day gift guide). Paired with a few nice beer glasses, this two-pack is a unique gift that ensures your beer lover will never sip warm brew again.Ember Temperature Control Smart MugNo one likes lukewarm coffee. In lieu of a boring water bottle, keep your man’s java piping hot with this temperature control smart mug that you can operate with a smartphone. And thanks to Amazon’s speedy shipping, we think it would make an especially nice last-minute gift.Five Two Barware Essentials SetMaybe he’s been dropping hints about a new cocktail-making hobby—or maybe you’d love for someone else to make the drinks every once in a while. Whatever it may be, this set of wine markers, a magnetic felt drip catcher, brass bottle stoppers, wine bottle tote, felt coasters, and bottle opener is a more subtle nudge.Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza OvenIt’s not a car, but your brother will feel like he’s on Top Chef with this gas-powered pizza oven that reaches an impressive 950 degrees in 15 minutes and cooks a 12-inch pie in just 60 seconds.Birdfy Smart Bird Feeder with CameraTake his amateur bird-watching hobby to the next level with this chic-looking bird feeder that uses AI to identify what kinds of winged friends are visiting the smart hangout.Ninja CREAMi Deluxe Ice Cream MakerNinja's Creami Deluxe will let him make his dream ice cream pints, as well as sorbet, gelato, milkshakes, and smoothie bowls. It's all thanks to “Creamify Technology,” that helps transform frozen bases into creamy delights.Whiskey Peaks Half Dome DecanterIf he’s a California native, he’ll definitely appreciate this spirits decanter inspired by Yosemite National Park’s Half Dome peak. It’s unbelievably made from hand-blown glass, so slight variations are to be expected.Butcher's Choice BoxThis gift box from Porter Road is a griller’s delight. The handpicked curation includes a selection of dry aged steaks, sirloin filets, pork chops, dry aged ground beef, a pound of pork bacon, plus a seasonal item that changes each month.Houseplant Green Ridge AshtraySmoking accessories don’t get more luxe than the designs coming from Houseplant. This particular ashtray’s shape is inspired by a salty snack—who knew ridges could provide such a picturesque holding spot for a cigarette or joint?Brightland Mini EssentialsWith high-quality olive oils and vinegars, a little bit goes a long way. That’s why this sampler set of Brightland’s four essential bottles is the ideal gift for any aspiring cook or foodie dude.Breville Barista Express Espresso MachineMake your coffee lover into a barista with this user-friendly Breville espresso machine. Thanks to the integrated grinder, it’s a one-stop-shop for cappuccinos, macchiatos, and all the other delicious third-wave coffee drinks out there.Hot Ones Hot Sauce 10 PackTest their heat tolerance with a set of hot sauces from the very same crew that’s responsible for Hot Ones. This pack of 10 bottles is inspired by season 23 of the show, so they can go head to head with celebrities like Barry Keoghan, Shakira, and Ice Spice.New York Times Custom Football BookWhether you’re shopping for a Christmas present or birthday gift, your favorite football fan will love an anthology on their go-to team. These books gather printed coverage from The New York Times to create a history of some of the most popular football teams in the country.Aarke Copper Carbonator 3If he's a big seltzer guy this Aarke is pretty much the Rolls-Royce of carbonator. It'll look extra-sleek sitting on his countertop next to his collection of matching copper pots and pans.Mercado Famous Holy JamonMercado Famous’s Jamón sampler is a thoughtful gift idea for your fave foodie. Each set comes with all three of the brand’s tasty packs sourced from Spain and ready to eat.Do Your Whiskey Make Your Own Whiskey KitThis creative DIY whiskey kit includes three types of oak and six herbs and spices so your dude can blend his own whiskey mix. Though if you’re looking to go above and beyond, we recommend also checking out this personalized barrel from Uncommon Goods.YETI Colster Can InsulatorNever let your man’s beer (or seltzer!) get warm with Yeti’s sleek can insulator that maintains the liquid’s straight-out-of-the-cooler temperature even on the hottest of summer days. A matching keychain and a pack of his favorite brew should elevate the surprise.Material Trio of KnivesAnother kitchen must-have, this trio of knives is made of cryogenically-tempered Japanese stainless steel and high carbon, with stain-resistant composite handles. With these three in his arsenal, your dude can whip up anything.Bellhop Table Lamp by Edward Barber, Jay Osgerby for FLOSIf they’re the light of your life, light up theirs with one of our favorite portable lamps. The Mug by East ForkWhether it’s coffee or tea that starts their mornings, this new mug from East Fork will easily become the new favorite.Great Jones x Fellow KettlePerfect for hot beverages, or for when he’s craving an instant ramen on the spot, Fellow’s colorful collaboration with Great Jones is an elevated kitchen staple we approve of.Self-care & tech giftsTheragun Prime PlusIf he works out and travels a lot, this tiny muscle massager is one of the best gift ideas out there. The upgraded Theragun Prime Plus packs a ton of power into its three foam attachments. Plus its Bluetooth capability means you can connect it to the Theragun app for personalized use recommendations.Le Labo Hinoki Hand PomadeChapped hands don’t stand a chance against Le Labo’s moisturizer, which features a nourishing blend of shea butter, coconut oil, and almond oil.Brooklinen Weighted Throw BlanketSometimes the cure for a bad day is diving right under a weighted blanket and staying put for an hour or three. Clocking in at 12 pounds, this breathable throw is light enough to nap under without having claustrophobic nightmares.Apple AirTag (4-Pack)We all lose things; there’s no getting around that. But have them slap an AirTag on that thing they keep misplacing—keys, phone, headphones, shame (just kidding on that last one, we can’t help there)—and it’ll instantly lower their stress levels.Recess Newport SetWe all have that person who is constantly trying out whatever the latest trend in sports may be. Feed that habit with a set that delivers everything they’ll need for impromptu games of pickleball. The paddle is made with a lightweight (and durable!) fiberglass and the sanded texture means they can perfect their spin shot.Pioneer DJ DDJ-REV7 2-Channel Motorized DJ ControllerFor the guy who loves to control the aux—this professional DJ deck is bound to delight. Don't be surprised if he spends the next few months on set lists to be performed at the next house party or rooftop gathering.Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth HeadphonesTechies will never refuse an upgrade to their headphones. When it comes to tech gifts, there are lots of audio options out there, but these over-ear ones from Bose offer world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth pairing they won’t have to fight to actually use, and a noise-rejecting microphone system. It’s a whole lot of power in a beautiful package. Go forth and skip the Apple Watch in favor of something a bit different.Hatch Restore 2 Bedside Light, Sound Machine & Sunrise Alarm ClockGetting up is hard and anyone who says otherwise is (probably) lying a little bit. The Hatch lamp helps make it a little easier, probably because it’s a full-fledged wake-up machine in one tiny package. Not only can the user set the traditional alarm, but there’s a time-activated light “alarm” that makes it feel like a little sliver of the sun has slipped right into the room. To round things out, the sound machine is great for lulling people to sleep.Cozy Earth Serenity Silk Sleep MaskIt’s likely he wouldn’t think of all the benefits a silk sleep mask might have on his nighttime routine—but you will.Loftie Alarm ClockWaking up is slightly easier when you have an alarm clock that houses meditations, breath work circuits, Bluetooth speaker capabilities, and a gentle two-step system for jostling someone out of sleep. This is that alarm clock.Postcard Cabins StayIf he’s a nature buff, a weekend trip courtesy of Getaway is a gift the both of you can enjoy. With cabins located nationwide and stays starting at $109 per night (pending location, seasonality, and availability), a picturesque vacation is just a few clicks away.Sonos RoamMinimalist, compact, and rechargeable, this portable waterproof smart bluetooth speaker is chic enough to display at home, yet also small enough to bring along just about anywhere.Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation)If your dad is still listening to podcasts with wired headphones, Apple AirPods are a sure-fire gift choice that he can pair perfectly with his iPhone via Bluetooth. Not only are these earbuds wireless, but they also boast noise-cancellation technology for an immersive music experience.Theragun MiniIf he's already got his full-size Theragun, this miniature will be equally beloved. It's compact enough to fit in a smaller tote and can easily to transported to the gym or on vacations.Bang & Olufsen Beolit 20 SpeakerIf you'd rather take your audio cues from Alicia Keys and Swizz Beatz, gift him this portable speaker that's got Up to 37 hours of playtime, charges in 3 hours, and has a convenient handle for carrying to the BBQ or park hang.Tsu Lange Yor Aromatic Candle Art (Set of 3)Get his space one step closer to Troye Sivan's Australian hideaway with this scent set from the It-Boy's brand. It includes all three sultry scents—TLY 5755, Pool, and Sassafras—that are housed in candles he can proudly display in his own bachelor pad.
html:
Guys are notoriously hard to shop for, so finding the perfect gifts for the men in your life can be a challenge. What do you buy for the dad who says he needs socks for the fifth year in a row? (Hint: definitely not the socks he’s been buying himself.) Or the brother with a splurge-laden wish list of expensive gadgets and watches? (Hint: neither of those things.) Or the husband who would be happy with no gift at all (or worse, a gift card)? (Hint: not nothing…also, can’t relate!)

The answer is a set of cozy Bombas socks. Or an Ooni gas-powered pizza oven. Or a stylish Shinola desk clock. Or any of the very covetable presents on this list, which we compiled specifically to please your pickiest, unhelpful-hint-giving (favorite) men. So, without further ado, we present to you the best gifts for men.

Shop Our Top Picks

  • Best for self-care enthusiasts: Theragun Prime Plus, $399 from Therabody
  • Best for aspiring chefs: Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399 now $319 from Ooni
  • Best bling: Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet, $98 from Mejuri
  • Best for travel: Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack, $198 from Lululemon

Shop by section:

  • Accessories & apparel gifts
  • Home & kitchen gifts
  • Self-care & tech gifts

Accessories & Apparel

Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack

Never underestimate the power of a really good duffel bag. This one seamlessly transforms into a backpack—a massive feature if the guy in your life is often on the go. It’s made with water-repellant fabric, tons of exterior and interior pocket space, a handy water bottle pouch, adjustable straps, and a sleek look that won’t drag their travel outfit down.

Bottega Veneta Intrecciato Leather Card Case

A black leather wallet is expected. But a slim card holder with Bottega’s signature leather weave? Just the right kind of surprise.

Sterling Silver Kintsugi Cufflinks by Posh Totty Designs

Sometimes a unique pair of cufflinks is just the thing to take a tried-and-true suit to the next level. We love this Kintsugi-inspired design—as would the man in your life who just went on a recent trip to Japan.

Barbour Ashby Waxed Cotton Jacket

This classic wax jacket can easily be dressed up or down—whether you’re headed to the office or Glastonbury festival. Barbour is a classic for a reason—the English brand has nailed the balance between “lightweight and breathable” and “durable enough to qualify as a family heirloom.”

On Lightweight Cap

A fully waterproof hat is hard to come by—ask any hiker, cyclist, or Seattleite. This design from athletic brand On has laser-cut panels from increased breathability and a buckle strap for easy adjustment, and there’s a matching top and jacket (hint, hint).

Quince Onyx Rectangular Ring

Some of the best men’s gifts come in small packages—like this 18k gold vermeil ring. It’s subtle enough to pair well with a T-shirt but can pull its own weight with a suit as well.

Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet

Available in sterling silver or 14k gold, this simple bracelet is the perfect accessory for any outfit.

A.P.C. Treck Backpack

Level up his college-era backpack with this sleek A.P.C. number. It’s designed with adjustable padded shoulder straps for maximum comfort and has a branded carabiner clip that’ll be a subtle nod to his climbing hobby.

Bombas Sunday Slipper

It’s more than likely the old slippers he’s using are hanging on by a thread. These elevated designs from Bombas are ultra cozy and won’t be an eyesore.

Polo Ralph Lauren Plaid Fringe Wool Scarf

A luxe scarf is one of those things we’ll always want but won’t necessarily buy for ourselves. But unwrapping a present and seeing the peek of plaid and fringe? You won’t find many people who wouldn’t be delighted to open up a stylish scarf. This design from Polo is the perfect pop of color for any look.

Patagonia Synchilla Fleece Gloves

If his favorite T-shirts and pullovers come from Patagonia, these gloves in the brand’s warm Synchilla recycled fleece material will likely be a winner.

L.L. Bean Men's Mountain Classic Quilted Ankle Boots

Indoor slippers are one thing, but backyard slippers? There’s a concept. Sometimes you just have to hop outside for a second. A supportive footbed paired with fleece lining and a non-slip rubber sole makes these a powerhouse without skimping on maximum loungewear-level comfort.

Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed Beanie

Crafted with Mongolian cashmere, this super soft ribbed beanie is a wintertime staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie). Your man can rock it throughout the winter.

Buck Mason Vintage Thermal Henley

While sweats will always have their place in a loungewear collection, we’re all about the henleys for cooler temps. Made of woven cotton and available in five rich colors, this tee plays well as a layer or on its own with a pair of jeans. He’ll love the versatility, which is a gift in itself.

Parachute Cloud Cotton Robe

This lightweight Turkish cotton bath robe is exactly what he’ll want to put on after getting out of bed during lazy mornings when he’s got time to lounge around.

Eberjey William Tencel Modal Long PJ Set

Again, pajamas and loungewear are always a treat—especially when they’re insanely soft like this sustainable Tencel Modal Eberjey set. The matching button-down top and pull-on bottoms feature white piping for a classic look.

Bombas Men's Merino Wool Blend Quarter Socks

One serious pop of color paired with a tried-and-true neutral—this is what a gift set of socks should be. Made of a super comfortable merino wool blend, they’ll feel like they’re walking on clouds all day long. We’ll stand behind it: Socks make for the best gift, no matter the celebration.

The North Face Thermoball Traction Mule V Mens Slippers

He’ll think of you every time he slides into these rubber-sole slippers (which will be often).

On Cloud 5 Sneakers

The lightest-weight sneaker imaginable, On Cloud 5s are engineered for an active lifestyle. Your sporty dude can wear them all day long, from the gym to the streets.

Alex Mill Garment Dyed Work Jacket

For your favorite fashionisto, this timeless work jacket from New York–based Alex Mill is a great gift idea that can be dressed up or down. The sturdy recycled denim fabric is peppered with flecks of natural cotton for an artisan texture.

MOFT Flash Wallet and Stand

Some people don’t love bulky phone cases with PopSockets and other gadgets…. But they still want a better grip and a spot to store often-used cards. This wallet doubles as a magnetic stand, meaning they can flip their phone into viewing mode in an instant.

Arc'teryx Atom Insulated Jacket

Arc'teryx's lightweight windbreaker is an ideal get for just about anyone on your list—from the guy who likes to jog in subzero temperatures to the jetsetter who always needs more room in his carry-on.

Snow Peak Fire-Resistant Outdoor Cap

You can never have too many caps—especially ones that are made from water-resistant and flame-retardant materials like this Snow Peak design.

Omega SpeedMaster Professional Moonwatch

An exceptional guy calls for an exceptional timepiece. For marking especially important holidays or milestones, this Omega watch is a gift that will be hard to top

Mark & Graham Monogrammed Travel Watch Roll

If they can’t be seen without their favorite watch (or second-favorite, or third-favorite) fastened around their wrist, upgrade their travel accessory situation with this personalized gift. Made of durable polyurethane exterior and a soft microsuede interior (no scratches here!), there’s enough room for three watches inside.

Home & Kitchen

Shinola Runwell Desk Clock

Even better than wrist candy, this chrome-and-black Shinola desk clock is the perfect home decor gift for your watch collector brother. Plus, the handsome timepiece is accompanied by a convenient wooden stand.

Atlas Coffee Club Gift Subscription

This gift subscription from Atlas Coffee Company will supply him with three-to-twelve months of the best beans around. You'll be able to select when shipments start and each delivery postcards and tasting notes.

Revival Molecule Doormat

A color block welcome mat like this design from Revival could also double as a housewarming gift for your friend who just moved into a new bachelor pad.

Braun Classic Analogue Wall Clock

We all have that friend who is constantly late. This wall clock probably won’t help that cause, but its slight utilitarian vibe makes it a designer-level addition to any room.

Make Your Own Hot Sauce Kit

It seems like there are only two sides to the hot sauce spectrum: You either love it—like “can’t get enough heat” kind of obsession—or you avoid it at all costs. For the former, this set will let them tweak that liquid gold within an inch of the preference.

Philips Hue Smart LED Bar Light

The Hue Smart Bar is a surprisingly versatile gadget. He can stand it on his desk or mount it to the wall for an added light source or even upgrade his entertainment system by using it as a TV backlight.

Technivorm Moccamaster 53942 KBGV

The sunny Moccamaster coffee maker from Technivorm is one of the most stylish machines out there. Thanks to its simplicity and dialed-in design, it’s super easy to use—you just fill the brew basket, add water, and flip the on/off switch. It brews in just 5-6 minutes and can handle up to 10 cups of coffee at one time. Plus, the pop of yellow would look great on any countertop

Craighill Cal Bookend (Pair)

Bibliophiles and paperback aficionados can rest assured that these sleek-looking bookends from Craighill will support their reads.

Weber Small Stainless Steel Vegetable Basket

For the BBQ grill master who has everything, this small vegetable basket will always be appreciated. It helps keep veggies fresh and grill-mark-free while delivering all the flavor a grill has to offer.

Corkcicle Chillsner (Two-Pack)

Beer bottles, on the other hand, are best kept chilled with Corkcicle’s Chillsner, an icy stick that you pop in the freezer (and a best seller from our Father’s Day gift guide). Paired with a few nice beer glasses, this two-pack is a unique gift that ensures your beer lover will never sip warm brew again.

Ember Temperature Control Smart Mug

No one likes lukewarm coffee. In lieu of a boring water bottle, keep your man’s java piping hot with this temperature control smart mug that you can operate with a smartphone. And thanks to Amazon’s speedy shipping, we think it would make an especially nice last-minute gift.

Five Two Barware Essentials Set

Maybe he’s been dropping hints about a new cocktail-making hobby—or maybe you’d love for someone else to make the drinks every once in a while. Whatever it may be, this set of wine markers, a magnetic felt drip catcher, brass bottle stoppers, wine bottle tote, felt coasters, and bottle opener is a more subtle nudge.

Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven

It’s not a car, but your brother will feel like he’s on Top Chef with this gas-powered pizza oven that reaches an impressive 950 degrees in 15 minutes and cooks a 12-inch pie in just 60 seconds.

Birdfy Smart Bird Feeder with Camera

Take his amateur bird-watching hobby to the next level with this chic-looking bird feeder that uses AI to identify what kinds of winged friends are visiting the smart hangout.

Ninja CREAMi Deluxe Ice Cream Maker

Ninja's Creami Deluxe will let him make his dream ice cream pints, as well as sorbet, gelato, milkshakes, and smoothie bowls. It's all thanks to “Creamify Technology,” that helps transform frozen bases into creamy delights.

Whiskey Peaks Half Dome Decanter

If he’s a California native, he’ll definitely appreciate this spirits decanter inspired by Yosemite National Park’s Half Dome peak. It’s unbelievably made from hand-blown glass, so slight variations are to be expected.

Butcher's Choice Box

This gift box from Porter Road is a griller’s delight. The handpicked curation includes a selection of dry aged steaks, sirloin filets, pork chops, dry aged ground beef, a pound of pork bacon, plus a seasonal item that changes each month.

Houseplant Green Ridge Ashtray

Smoking accessories don’t get more luxe than the designs coming from Houseplant. This particular ashtray’s shape is inspired by a salty snack—who knew ridges could provide such a picturesque holding spot for a cigarette or joint?

Brightland Mini Essentials

With high-quality olive oils and vinegars, a little bit goes a long way. That’s why this sampler set of Brightland’s four essential bottles is the ideal gift for any aspiring cook or foodie dude.

Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine

Make your coffee lover into a barista with this user-friendly Breville espresso machine. Thanks to the integrated grinder, it’s a one-stop-shop for cappuccinos, macchiatos, and all the other delicious third-wave coffee drinks out there.

Hot Ones Hot Sauce 10 Pack

Test their heat tolerance with a set of hot sauces from the very same crew that’s responsible for Hot Ones. This pack of 10 bottles is inspired by season 23 of the show, so they can go head to head with celebrities like Barry Keoghan, Shakira, and Ice Spice.

New York Times Custom Football Book

Whether you’re shopping for a Christmas present or birthday gift, your favorite football fan will love an anthology on their go-to team. These books gather printed coverage from The New York Times to create a history of some of the most popular football teams in the country.

Aarke Copper Carbonator 3

If he's a big seltzer guy this Aarke is pretty much the Rolls-Royce of carbonator. It'll look extra-sleek sitting on his countertop next to his collection of matching copper pots and pans.

Mercado Famous Holy Jamon

Mercado Famous’s Jamón sampler is a thoughtful gift idea for your fave foodie. Each set comes with all three of the brand’s tasty packs sourced from Spain and ready to eat.

Do Your Whiskey Make Your Own Whiskey Kit

This creative DIY whiskey kit includes three types of oak and six herbs and spices so your dude can blend his own whiskey mix. Though if you’re looking to go above and beyond, we recommend also checking out this personalized barrel from Uncommon Goods.

YETI Colster Can Insulator

Never let your man’s beer (or seltzer!) get warm with Yeti’s sleek can insulator that maintains the liquid’s straight-out-of-the-cooler temperature even on the hottest of summer days. A matching keychain and a pack of his favorite brew should elevate the surprise.

Material Trio of Knives

Another kitchen must-have, this trio of knives is made of cryogenically-tempered Japanese stainless steel and high carbon, with stain-resistant composite handles. With these three in his arsenal, your dude can whip up anything.

Bellhop Table Lamp by Edward Barber, Jay Osgerby for FLOS

If they’re the light of your life, light up theirs with one of our favorite portable lamps.

The Mug by East Fork

Whether it’s coffee or tea that starts their mornings, this new mug from East Fork will easily become the new favorite.

Great Jones x Fellow Kettle

Perfect for hot beverages, or for when he’s craving an instant ramen on the spot, Fellow’s colorful collaboration with Great Jones is an elevated kitchen staple we approve of.

Self-care & tech gifts

Theragun Prime Plus

If he works out and travels a lot, this tiny muscle massager is one of the best gift ideas out there. The upgraded Theragun Prime Plus packs a ton of power into its three foam attachments. Plus its Bluetooth capability means you can connect it to the Theragun app for personalized use recommendations.

Le Labo Hinoki Hand Pomade

Chapped hands don’t stand a chance against Le Labo’s moisturizer, which features a nourishing blend of shea butter, coconut oil, and almond oil.

Brooklinen Weighted Throw Blanket

Sometimes the cure for a bad day is diving right under a weighted blanket and staying put for an hour or three. Clocking in at 12 pounds, this breathable throw is light enough to nap under without having claustrophobic nightmares.

Apple AirTag (4-Pack)

We all lose things; there’s no getting around that. But have them slap an AirTag on that thing they keep misplacing—keys, phone, headphones, shame (just kidding on that last one, we can’t help there)—and it’ll instantly lower their stress levels.

Recess Newport Set

We all have that person who is constantly trying out whatever the latest trend in sports may be. Feed that habit with a set that delivers everything they’ll need for impromptu games of pickleball. The paddle is made with a lightweight (and durable!) fiberglass and the sanded texture means they can perfect their spin shot.

Pioneer DJ DDJ-REV7 2-Channel Motorized DJ Controller

For the guy who loves to control the aux—this professional DJ deck is bound to delight. Don't be surprised if he spends the next few months on set lists to be performed at the next house party or rooftop gathering.

Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones

Techies will never refuse an upgrade to their headphones. When it comes to tech gifts, there are lots of audio options out there, but these over-ear ones from Bose offer world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth pairing they won’t have to fight to actually use, and a noise-rejecting microphone system. It’s a whole lot of power in a beautiful package. Go forth and skip the Apple Watch in favor of something a bit different.

Hatch Restore 2 Bedside Light, Sound Machine & Sunrise Alarm Clock

Getting up is hard and anyone who says otherwise is (probably) lying a little bit. The Hatch lamp helps make it a little easier, probably because it’s a full-fledged wake-up machine in one tiny package. Not only can the user set the traditional alarm, but there’s a time-activated light “alarm” that makes it feel like a little sliver of the sun has slipped right into the room. To round things out, the sound machine is great for lulling people to sleep.

Cozy Earth Serenity Silk Sleep Mask

It’s likely he wouldn’t think of all the benefits a silk sleep mask might have on his nighttime routine—but you will.

Loftie Alarm Clock

Waking up is slightly easier when you have an alarm clock that houses meditations, breath work circuits, Bluetooth speaker capabilities, and a gentle two-step system for jostling someone out of sleep. This is that alarm clock.

Postcard Cabins Stay

If he’s a nature buff, a weekend trip courtesy of Getaway is a gift the both of you can enjoy. With cabins located nationwide and stays starting at $109 per night (pending location, seasonality, and availability), a picturesque vacation is just a few clicks away.

Sonos Roam

Minimalist, compact, and rechargeable, this portable waterproof smart bluetooth speaker is chic enough to display at home, yet also small enough to bring along just about anywhere.

Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation)

If your dad is still listening to podcasts with wired headphones, Apple AirPods are a sure-fire gift choice that he can pair perfectly with his iPhone via Bluetooth. Not only are these earbuds wireless, but they also boast noise-cancellation technology for an immersive music experience.

Theragun Mini

If he's already got his full-size Theragun, this miniature will be equally beloved. It's compact enough to fit in a smaller tote and can easily to transported to the gym or on vacations.

Bang & Olufsen Beolit 20 Speaker

If you'd rather take your audio cues from Alicia Keys and Swizz Beatz, gift him this portable speaker that's got Up to 37 hours of playtime, charges in 3 hours, and has a convenient handle for carrying to the BBQ or park hang.

Tsu Lange Yor Aromatic Candle Art (Set of 3)

Get his space one step closer to Troye Sivan's Australian hideaway with this scent set from the It-Boy's brand. It includes all three sultry scents—TLY 5755, Pool, and Sassafras—that are housed in candles he can proudly display in his own bachelor pad.
